x-javaEnums.name: ONE
x-javaEnums.title: The first number.
x-javaEnums.description: 1 (one, also called unit, unity, and (multiplicative) identity) is a number, and a numerical digit used to represent that number in numerals. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1)

x-javaEnums.name: TWO
x-javaEnums.title: The second number.
x-javaEnums.description:
2 (two) is a number, numeral, and glyph. 

It is the natural number following 1 and preceding 3. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2)

x-javaEnums.name: THREE
x-javaEnums.title: The third number.
x-javaEnums.description: 3 (three) is a number, numeral, and glyph. It is the natural number following 2 and preceding 4. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3)

x-javaEnums.name: FOUR
x-javaEnums.title: The fourth number.
x-javaEnums.description: 4 (four) is a number, numeral, and glyph. It is the natural number following 3 and preceding 5. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/4)
